Sentence.sentence: Since tobacco is one of the biggest causes of premature death in the UK, a measure that tames the habit even by a fraction is worth trying.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Premature death rates resulting from smoking have declined.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The leading causes of death in this age group are also changing.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: That pushed flu from the third leading cause of death to the fifth.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: One reason for the rise in deaths from Alzheimer’s disease in this group may be that developing this condition remains possible even after people beat the odds of dying from other diseases such as cancer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: On the other hand, the death rate from flu dropped from 7.4% in 2000 to 4.1% in 2014.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: In recent years, the death rate among American centenarians—people who have lived to age 100 or older—has decreased, dropping 14% for women and 20% for men from 2008 to 2014.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: In 2000, the top five causes of death for centenarians were heart disease, stroke, flu, cancer and Alzheimer’s Disease.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But by 2014, the death rate from Alzheimer’s Disease for this age group have more than doubled, increasing from 3.8% to 8.5%, making the progressive brain disease the second leading cause of death for centenarians.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But because this population is getting larger, the number of deaths in this group is also increasing.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: John Rother, the AARP's head of policy and strategy, points to studies showing that other things being equal, people who remain at work have lower death rates than their retired peers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Don't risk injury or death beacuse of over-confidence or lack of knowledge.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Consistently, research shows that communicating with others promotes health, whereas social isolation is linked to stress, disease, and early death.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But insurance will be cold comfort following the failure on October 31st of VSS Enterprise, resulting in the death of one pilot and the severe injury to another.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: But its surface has been cooked and dried by an ocean of carbon dioxide, trapped in the burning death grip of a runaway greenhouse effect.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Chemical testing showed that over the two years before her death, she moved about every two months.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Flamingos, however, are the only species that actually makes life in the midst of all that death.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Her time-lapse videos of the revivals look like someone playing a tape of the plant's death in reverse.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: It is becoming increasingly clear that retail reinvention isn't a simple battle to the death between bricks and clicks.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: right now, to reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome, the American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that mothers not sleep in the same bed as their babies, but sleep in the same room.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The death of a small child would have no effect upon the income of the family.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Three hundred years after her death, Merian will be celebrated at an international symposium in Amsterdam this June.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Through careful preparation, the death toll from a super tropical storm in November 2007 was less than 3, 500.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

example.en: Look like that's the death warrant for our plan.
example.zh: 看来那就是我们计划的致命缺陷。

list.explanation: 令人恐惧的，精疲力竭的，悲惨凄苦的，像死人一般的0h, my God! You look like death warmed over! 啊，我的天!你的脸色好吓人!

example.en: A tall, black-garbed gentleman lay there, looking like death warmed up.
example.zh: 那儿躺了一个高个子穿黑衣服的绅士，看上去像死人一般。

list.explanation: (指某人丧命、遭灾或某事溃败、解体的直接原因)致命伤，祸根

example.en: Your attitude was the kiss of death for your employment here.
example.zh: 你的态度对于你在这儿的工作而言致命的弱点。

list.explanation: 损害，毁坏，损坏某物的原因

example.en: This kind of road is just death on tyres.
example.zh: 这种道路最容易磨损汽车轮胎。

example.en: This candy is death on my teeth.
example.zh: 这种糖果是坏我牙齿的祸根。

list.explanation: (乘某种交通工具)快速运行、行进

example.en: He is way fast——just death on wheels.
example.zh: 他很快地离去了——乘汽车匪快地走了。

example.en: Pete is death on skis. You ought to see him go.
example.zh: 皮特蹬上滑雪板飞快地走了。你应该看见他走的。

stems_affixes.word_buile: dea死,消亡+ed表形容词→adj.死亡的;无生命的 n.死者
dead[adj.死亡的;无生命的 n.死者]+ly表形容词[放在名词后]或副词[形容词后]→adj.致命的,致死的 adv.非常地,如死一般地
dead[adj.死亡的;无生命的 n.死者]+ly表形容词[放在名词后]或副词[形容词后]→adj.致命的,致死的 adv.非常地,如死一般地
dea死,消亡+ed表形容词→adj.死亡的;无生命的 n.死者
dead死亡的+line线→死亡线→不能过的线→最后期限
dea死,消亡+th表名词→ n. 死亡;灭亡,毁灭

word_mean: 死亡：所有维持生命的身体功能永久停止。为了法律及医学上的目的，建议将死亡定义为：不可逆地停止全部脑功能，呼吸系统的自动功能和循环系统的自动功能

Sentence.sentence: Brooks carries this through to the death of one of his characters.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: But pronouncing the death of class is too early.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Dance expresses love and hate, joy and sorrow, life and death, and everything else in between.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Had the governments and scientists not worked together, aids-related deaths would not have fallen since their highest in 2005.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 单项选择 原文

Sentence.sentence: Hannah's place is divided into several areas, providing shelter for people when it is so cold that sleeping outdoors can mean death.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: "I knew it was the difference between life and death," says Taylor.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Now it occurred to him that his farm had much potential and that the death of the cow was a bit of luck.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: One of the executives gathered at the Aspen Institute for a day-long leadership workshop using the works of Shakespeare was discussing the role of brutus in the death of julius caesar.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Only five years after Steve Jobs' death, smart-phones defeated conventional PCs in sales.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: She had requested the community to tum it into a museum upon her death.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Still, the people who exercise 150 minutes a week did pretty well, too, lowering their death risk by 14%.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: The annual death rate for adult condors has dropped from 38% in 2000 to 5%.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The death of Russians may result in a shrinking population, which would damage its economic future.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 任务型阅读 题设

Sentence.sentence: The miracle of 1511 took place during six freezing works called the winter of death.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The proposal attempts to deal with what some call the "death valley" of autonomous vehicles: the grey area between semi-autonomous and fully driverless cars that could delay the driverless future.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The study showed that people who put in 300 minutes a week of exercise had a 20% lower risk of death due to heart disease.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: This affects their nervous systems and ability to produce baby birds, and can lead to kidney failures and death.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Two of the authors of the review also made a study published in 2014 which/that showed a mere five to 10 minutes a day of running reduced the risk of heart disease and early deaths from all causes.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Neville Cardus, who wrote for the Manchester Guardian from 1917 until shortly before his death in 1975,is now known solely as a writer of essays on the game of cricket.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Journalistic tastes had changed long before his death, and postmodern reader shave little use for the richly upholstered Vicwardian prose in which he specialized.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And the ban on ultra-thin models seems to go beyond protecting models from starving themselves to death – as some have done.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: By the time Shakespeare was twenty-five, Lyly, Peele, and Greene had made comedies that were at once popular and literary; Kyd had written a tragedy that crowded the pit; and Marlowe had brought poetry and genius to triumph on the common stage - where they had played no part since the death of Euripides.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Journalistic tastes had changed long before his death, and postmodern readers have little use for the richly upholstered vicwardian prose in which he specialized.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Neville Cardus, who wrote for the Manchester Guardian from 1917 until shortly before his death in 1975, is now known solely as a writer of essays on the game of cricket.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Offering up such a theory during a time of high tension between scientific and religious minds was branded as heresy, and any such heretics that continued to spread these lies were to be punished by imprisonment or even death.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The three Ds—death, debt and divorce—still deliver works of art to the market.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: Car accidents have caused many deaths.
sentences.cn: 车祸造成了许多人死亡。

means.word_mean: 毁灭, 消失, 终止

sentences.en: Bankruptcy was the death of his plans.
sentences.cn: 破产毁了他的计划。

jx.jx_en_mean: (often used hyperbolically or humorously) cause someone's death
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［常作夸张或幽默用法］置…于死地

lj.lj_ly: you'll be the death of me with all your questions.
lj.lj_ls: 你那么多问题要把我问死了。

jx.jx_en_mean: be present when a hunted animal is caught and killed
come to an end; cease or fail to be popular or successful

lj.lj_ly: the craze for cycling shorts is dying a death.
lj.lj_ls: 骑车短裤的热潮快结束了。

jx.jx_en_mean: perform or repeat something so frequently that it becomes tediously familiar

lj.lj_ly: a subject that has been done to death by generations of painters.
lj.lj_ls: 被世代画家画得让人厌烦的题材。

jx.jx_en_mean: a terrible experience, especially that of seduction or rape
jx.jx_cn_mean: 比死还不济的遭遇（尤指受诱奸或强奸）

phrase.cizu_name: like death warmed up (或 北美
a matter of life and death

jx.jx_en_mean: kill someone, especially with official sanction

phrase.cizu_name: till (或 until) death us do part

jx.jx_en_mean: for as long as each of a couple live
Near to death; gravely ill or injured.

entry.def: Death is the permanent end of the life of a person or animal.

example.ex: 1.5 million people are in immediate danger of death from starvation.
example.tran: 150 万人正面临着被饿死的急迫危险。

example.ex: ...the thirtieth anniversary of her death...
example.tran: 她逝世 30 周年的纪念日

entry.def: A particular kind of death is a particular way of dying.

example.ex: They made sure that he died a horrible death...
example.tran: 他们让他死得很惨。

example.ex: He would rather have a decent death which served some purpose than a meaningless death.
example.tran: 他宁愿死得其所，也不想无谓地死去。

entry.def: The death of something is the permanent end of it.

example.ex: It meant the death of everything he had ever been or ever hoped to be.
example.tran: 这意味着他过去的一切存在或曾经希望的存在均已终结。

example.ex: ...the death of pop music.
example.tran: 流行音乐的死亡

entry.def: If you say that someone is at death's door, you mean they are very ill indeed and likely to die.

example.ex: He told his boss a tale about his mother being at death's door...
example.tran: 他向老板谎称自己的母亲病危。

example.ex: My dad was the same. He could be at death's door but wouldn't say a word.
example.tran: 我爸爸也一样。他就算已经病得快不行了也还是会一声不吭。

entry.def: If you say that you will fight to the death for something, you are emphasizing that you will do anything to achieve or protect it, even if you suffer as a consequence.

example.ex: He said they did not want war—but if attacked they would fight to the death...
example.tran: 他说他们不希望有战争——但一旦遭到攻击，定会战斗到底。

example.ex: She'd  have fought to the death for that child.
example.tran: 她会为了那个孩子抗争到底。

entry.def: If you refer to a fight or contest as a fight to the death, you are emphasizing that it will not stop until the death or total victory of one of the opponents.

example.ex: ...an eleven-hour fight to the death between a baboon and leopard...
example.tran: 一只狒狒和一头美洲豹之间长达 11小时的殊死搏斗

example.ex: He now faces a fight to the death to reach the quarter-finals.
example.tran: 他现在面临一场杀入四分之一决赛的殊死决战。

entry.def: If you say that something is a matter of life and death, you are emphasizing that it is extremely important, often because someone may die or suffer great harm if people do not act immediately.
entry.tran: 生死攸关的;至关重要的

example.ex: Well, never mind, John, it's not a matter of life and death...
example.tran: 好了，约翰，别太在意了。这又不是什么生死攸关的大事。

example.ex: We're dealing with a life-and-death situation here...
example.tran: 我们正面临一个生死关头。

entry.def: If someone is put to death, they are executed.

example.ex: Those put to death by firing squad included three generals.
example.tran: 行刑队处决的那些人里有 3 名将军。

entry.def: You use to death after a verb to indicate that a particular action or process results in someone's death.

example.ex: He was stabbed to death.
example.tran: 他被刀刺中身亡。

example.ex: ...relief missions to try to keep the country's population from starving to death...
example.tran: 努力确保该国人民不被饿死的救援任务

entry.def: You use to death after an adjective or a verb to emphasize the action, state, or feeling mentioned. For example, if you are frightened to death or bored to death, you are extremely frightened or bored.
entry.tran: (用于形容词或动词后，表示强调)吓得要死/无聊得要命

example.ex: He scares teams to death with his pace and power...
example.tran: 他的速度之快、力量之大让其他队胆战不已。

example.ex: Whereas 10 years ago I would have worried myself to death about it, now I accept it is part of the game...
example.tran: 10 年前我会为此担心得要命，但现在我接受了它是游戏的一部分。

entry.def: If you say that someone works another person to death, you are emphasizing that they make them work very hard indeed, especially in a way that seems cruel or unfair.
entry.tran: 使…累死累活地工作（或劳动）

example.ex: They worked themselves to death but never lost their humour.
example.tran: 他们累死累活地干活，但却从没有丢掉幽默感。

means.word_mean: 1. the event of dying or departure from life;

sentences.sentence: "her death came as a terrible shock"
"upon your decease the capital will pass to your grandchildren"

means.word_mean: 2. the permanent end of all life functions in an organism or part of an organism;
3. the time at which life ends; continuing until dead;
4. the absence of life or state of being dead;

sentences.sentence: "he seemed more content in death than he had ever been in life"
"it was the death of all his plans"
"he had two deaths on his conscience"
"the so-called glorious experiment came to an inglorious end"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dēath, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dood and German Tod, also to die

sentences.en: Police are trying to establish the cause of death .

sentences.cn: 该疫情的爆发在2009年4月末引起了全球性的关注，当时墨西哥当局注意到健康 的成年人中出现了异常多的住院治疗和死亡病例。
sentences.en: The outbreak came to global notice in late April 2009, when Mexican authorities noted an unusually large number of  hospitalizations and deaths among healthy adults.

sentences.cn: 在美国，已经有100多万人感染了甲型H1N1流感,而且它造成了60多人死亡，6000多人入院。
sentences.en: In the U.S., it has infected more than one million people, and caused more than 600 deaths and more than 6,000 hospitalizations

sentences.cn: 化验表明她死亡前的两年中，每两个月就换一个居住地。
sentences.en: Chemical testing showed that over the two years before her death, she moved about every two months.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 世界气象组织天气和灾害风险减少部门的主任Love说，大部分人员死亡和经济 损失都是由天气、气候或和水有关的极端事件造成的。
sentences.en: Love, who is director of Weather and Disaster Risk Reduction at the World Meteorological Organization, says most of the deaths and economic losses were caused by weather, climate, or waterrelated extremes.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 1970和1991 年的重大暴风潮造成了约44 万人死亡。
sentences.en: Major storm surges in 1970 and 1991 caused the deaths of about 440,000 people
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 在2007 年11 月，经过认真准备，一场超级热带风暴造成的死亡人数少于3,500 人。
sentences.en: Through careful preparation, the death toll from a super tropical storm in November 2007 was less than 3,500.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 近年来，美国百岁老 —— 活到一百岁及以上的人 —— 的死亡率下降了，在2008年到2014年间，女性的死亡率下降了14%，男性的死亡率下降了20%。
sentences.en: In  recent  years,  the  death  rate among  American  centenarians—people who have lived to age 100 or older—has decreased,  dropping  14%  for  women and  20%  for  men  from  2008  to 2014.
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 这一年龄群的主要死亡原因也发生了变化。
sentences.en: The  leading  causes  of  death  in  this  age group  are  also  changing
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 在2000年，百岁老人的五大主要死亡原 因是心脏病、中风、流感、癌症和阿尔茨海默病。
sentences.en: In  2000,  the top  five  causes  of  death  for  centenarians were  heart  disease,  stroke,  flu,  cancer and  Alzheimer’s  Disease.
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 这一群体中因阿尔茨海默病死亡的比率增加的原因之一可能是，即使在人们战胜了如癌症等其他疾病带来的死亡风险后，仍有患该病的可能。
sentences.en: One  reason  for  the  rise in  deaths  from  Alzheimer’s  disease  in this  group  may  be  that  developing  this condition  remains  possible  even  after people  beat  the  odds  of  dying  from other  diseases  such  as  cancer
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 另一方面，流感的死亡率从2000年的7.4%下降到2014年的4.1%。
sentences.en: On the other hand, the death rate from flu dropped from 7.4% in 2000 to 4.1% in 2014.
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 但是由于这一群体变得越来越大，该群体中的死亡人数 也在增加。
sentences.en: But  because  this population  is  getting  larger,  the  number of deaths in this group is also increasing
sentences.from: 16年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 在这个阶段，人们已经走到人生旅途的中间，发觉青春不再，前景堪忧，死亡也在步步逼近。
sentences.en: It’s the stage in the middle of the journey when people feel youth vanishing, their prospects narrowing and death approaching.
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 发现他们都打破了常规，因为“闷头走下去就是死亡”。
sentences.en: They break routines, because “autopilot is death.”
sentences.from: 17年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 大多数死亡的蜜蜂主要来自鲜花縝蜜蜂养殖场，它是萨默维尔市一家销售蜜蜂和蜂蜜 产品的公司。

sentences.cn: 干咳是死神的鼓手.

sentences.cn: 你可能得到第二次活着的机会, 但你无法欺骗死神.
sentences.en: You may get a second chance at life, But you can't cheat death.

sentences.en: Death is often a welcome release from pain.

sentences.cn: 死神吓不倒我.
sentences.en: Death holds no terrors for me.

sentences.cn: 你不可能欺骗死神两次.
sentences.en: You can't cheat death twice.

sentences.en: Sudden death came to the fathers, and no providence made for the daughters.

sentences.en: Diana River had designated her brother inexorable as death.

sentences.cn: 我自己不知不觉跌进了死神的陷阱.

sentences.en: The culture has label death unthinkable and unspeakable region.

sentences.en: Homer tells us also that Sisyphus had put Death in chains.

Sentence.sentence: They break routines, because autopilot is death.

Sentence.sentence: The middle-aged person, Barth continued, can see death in the distance, but moves with a measured haste to get big new things done while there is still time.

Sentence.sentence: It's the stage in the middle of the journey when people feel youth vanishing, their prospects narrowing and death approaching.

Sentence.sentence: Americans have always argued about the death penalty.

Sentence.sentence: It found that human-influenced climate change was raising the global death rates from illnesses including malnutrition (营养不良)and heat-related health problems.

Sentence.sentence: Rates of death from illnesses have risen due to global warming

Sentence.sentence: Global warming is causing more than 300,000 deaths and about $125 billion in economic losses each year, according to a report by the Global Humanitarian Forum, an organization led by Annan, the former United Nations secretary general.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: a political scientist at the University of Colorado, Boulder, who studies disaster trends, said the Forum's report was "a methodological embarrassment" because there was no way to distinguish deaths or economic losses related to human-driven global warming amid the much larger losses resulting from the growth in populations and economic development in vulnerable (易受伤害的) regions
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文
